isis.stitle: HOOD, GRILLE, FENDERS AND BUMPER - 7000 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - 7000 Model Hood

para.emph: The procedures outlined in this section and illustrated in Figures 14, 15, 16 and 17 are representative of current production hood assists and torsion bars on models built through February 1, 2003.

step1.para: Place wheel chocks at wheels as required.
Remove front bumper assembly ( Figure 12) as required.
Remove grille assembly or hood shroud. If the unit is furnished with a fixed grill assembly, the grille need not be removed.
Release hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the hood spring stop assemblies.

Disconnect front end pigtail connectors from the front end wire harness connector located at the top of the frame rail on both the drivers side and passenger side of the radiator ( Figure 13, Item 1). Remove wire harness clips and loop clamps securing the harness between dash panel and hood, as necessary. (The harness stays with the hood.)

figure.caption: Figure 13. Harness Connections (Each Side of Radiator)

para.emph: Figures 14 through 17 represent products built before February 01, 2003.

The front hood tilt assembly on models built before February 01, 2003 will utilize the dual octagon style torsion bars and hinge system. Hinges on these models are located on the outward edge of the hinge crossbar assembly.

step1.para: Remove center hood filler panel screws. (7600 Series models only)
Remove headlamp and turn signal assemblies, both sides.

step2.para: To remove headlamp assemblies, loosen the mounting nuts from the mounting studs located in the inside of the fender wells ( Figure 16, Item 4).

step1.para: Remove filler panel for access to hinge bracket bolts and torsion bars.

step1.para: Remove hood torsion bars.

step2.para: Loosen torsion bar spring pins ( Figure 18, Item 1) (each side). This will relieve tension on torsion bars.
Loosen and remove torsion bar mounting bracket bolts, two (2) each side.

step1.para: Remove driver side splash panel.
Disconnect hood stop cables.

step2.para: Remove the clevis pin from the clevis. Remove the clevis (Figure 21, Item 4) from the radiator clevis attachment bracket on the radiator top frame, driver and passenger side.

step1.para: With an assistant, remove the hood assembly. Place the hood on an appropriate padded surface to protect painted surfaces.
Remove front hinge bracket bolts.
Remove front hinge from hood.

svcsubproc.title: 7000 Series Model Hood - Install
svcsubproc.para: If required, assemble tilt assist and support spring assemblies, splash panels, insulator panels and the hood hinge plates to the hood before installing it.
Refer to Figure 19 for items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Place a padded work stand in front of the vehicle. With an assistant, rest the hood assembly on the work stand. Position the hood hinge section in place at the chassis hinge section (Item 3). Install the hood hinge pins and flat washers ( Figure 17, Item 2) from the outboard side into each hinge.
Install flat washers and lock clips (Item 9) on each of the hinge pins inboard side (Item 4).
With an assistant tilt the hood forward and rest on a padded floor stand.
Locate and replace the hood torsion bar brackets (Item 6) at each side of the hinge crossbar assembly.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 18 for items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Tilt the hood at approximately a 45 degree angle and insert the end of the torsion bar into the torsion bar end bracket. Insert the spring pin (Item 1) into the torsion bar end bracket ( Figure 23, Item 4). Lower the hood assembly. This will place tension on the torsion bars and assist assembly.
Raise the hood to approximately a 45 degree angle and support it, to allow for reconnection of the spring cable stops.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 21 for items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Place the clevis (Item 2) over the radiator clevis attachment bracket (Item 4). Insert the clevis pin (Item 2) through the clevis and clevis retaining bracket. Install the clevis pin clip through the clevis.

Reconnect front end wire harness connectors ( Figure 13, Item 1) and ground connections to the appropriate chassis harness pig tails. Secure the wire harness with the clips and loop clamps provided, as necessary.
Close the hood and latch the hood on both sides.

svcsubproc.title: 7000 Series Models Built After February 01, 2003

para.title: Removal
para.emph: The 7000 series models built after February 01, 2003 will incorporate a different torsion bar system, hood hinge assembly and hood frame reinforcing. Prior to removal check the assemblies to ensure the model requirement.

figure.caption: Figure 25. Torsion Bar Assembly - Units Built After February 01, 2003

calloutgroup.callout1: 5. FRAME MOUNTING BRACKET AND TORSION BAR END BRACKET

step1.para: Place wheel chocks at wheels as required.
Remove grille assembly or shroud hood shroud. (See grille assembly and or shroud assembly, Figure 34 or 35).
Release hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the hood spring stop assemblies.

Disconnect front end pigtail connectors from the front end wire harness connector ( Figure 13, Item 1) located at the top of the frame rail on the drivers side and passenger side of the radiator. Remove wire harness clips and loop clamps securing the harness between dash panel and hood, as necessary. (The harness stays with the hood.)

Remove the clevis pin ( Figure 21, Item 3) from the clevis. Remove the clevis from the radiator clevis attachment bracket ( Figure 21, Item 4) on the radiator top frame ( Figure 21, Item 3), driver and passenger side.

figure.caption: Figure 26. Torsion Bar Assembly Detail (Passenger Side Shown)

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 26 for items in parentheses, unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Locate the torsion bar hood tilt assist assembly upper brackets. Remove the retaining pin (Item 6) that secures the torsion assist bar to the hood tilt assist bracket driver and passenger side.
Remove the torsion assist bars (Item 4) from the chassis torsion bar retainer bracket (Item 2).

figure.caption: Figure 27. Torsion Bar Frame Mounted End Bracket

step1.para: With an assistant tilt the hood back to the original position.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 28 for items in parentheses, unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Locate the hood hinge pin and hex nut, on the hinge assembly (Items 1 and 2).

figure.caption: Figure 28. Hood Hinge Pin And Nut (Unit Built After Feb. 01, 2003)

step1.para: Loosen and remove the hinge bolt/pin flat washers and hex nuts.
With an assistant, remove the hood assembly. (Refer to Figure 29) Place the hood on an appropriate padded surface to protect painted surfaces.
